newsitem.title: USA: USDA-China bought soy and products in July 3 week.
newsitem.headline: USDA-China bought soy and products in July 3 week.

text.p: U.S. Agriculture Department said Thursday net soybean sales to China for delivery during the 1997/98 marketing year totaled 77,000 tonnes.
In its weekly export sales report, USDA said net soymeal sales to China for 1997/98 delivery in week ended July 3 rang in at 50,000 tonnes.

Earlier this week, U.S. exporters said Chinese buyers had been in the U.S. soy market recently. Tuesday, Chicago Board of Trade soybean futures climbed amid talk China had purchased old- and new-crop soybeans and old-crop soymeal.
In the export sales report, USDA also said China bought 22,000 tonnes soyoil for delivery during the 1996/97 marketing year in the week ended July 3.
